meta.hint: I is a subject pronoun. You can use it as the subject of a sentence. It tells that the  speaker is doing something, and it is usually at the beginning of the sentence. Example - I hug Rick. The subject pronoun I is the subject of the sentence.  Me is an object pronoun. You can use it after an action verb. Example - Rick hugs me. The object pronoun me is used after an action verb, hugs.  When a pronoun is connected to a noun with the word and (like Rick and I or Rick and  me), it can be hard to tell which pronoun is correct. To tell which one is correct, look at  the sentence without the other noun. Example - Rick and I like the teacher.                  I like the teacher. I is used as the subject of the sentence.  Example - The teacher likes Rick and me.                  The teacher likes me. Me is used after the action verb, likes.
meta.question: Select the correct pronoun to complete the sentence.
